title:
Light-cone sum rules study on the purely non-factorizable
  $\Lambda_{c}^{+}\to\Xi^{0}K^{+}$ decay
abstract:
We investigate the purely non-factorizable $\Lambda_{c}^{+}\to\Xi^{0}K^{+}$
decay using light-cone sum rules. To extract the decay amplitudes, a
three-point correlation function is defined and calculated at hadron and
quark-gluon level, respectively. Both the W-exchange and the W-inward emission
diagrams are considered in the quark-gluon level calculation, where the
two-particle light-cone distribution amplitudes (LCDAs) of kaon are used as
non-perturbative input. We obtain the decay amplitudes contributed from the
twist-2 and twist-3 kaon LCDAs, respectively. The obtained P-wave amplitude is
consistent with those predicted in the literature, while the S-wave one is much
smaller. This significant difference between the S- and P- wave amplitudes
leads to small up-down spin asymmetry, closing to the experimental measurement.
